climbs.name: west side left
climbs.fa: who knows maybe me but probly not

content.description: Follow the dihedral on the left, up through the chimney, and continuing up the ow squeeze chimney with some stemming up through the blocks at the top.  No anchor, set a directional #3 with lots of extension, then very carefully traverse right over the top of the fin being careful not to trundle teetering boulders on the way over to the anchors of black canyon simulator. Need at least 60 meters or more to touch down.
content.protection: Alot of small gear surprisingly, didn't use bigger than a #1.

content.description: Climb on big incut holds past a few fixed pins while also plugging in the occasional cam. Finish with slabby moves at the top with options existing to the left or the right before the anchor. Shares anchor with the Left Side South Face route.
content.protection: Fixed pins and cams to 2 inches.
content.location: On the right side of the west face look for a few old fixed pins marking the route.

climbs.name: West Face Middle (a.k.a. Black Canyon Simulator)

content.description:
I like to call this the Black Canyon Simulator because you get to climb on some pegmatite, tiptoe around some questionable holds and jam on Black Canyon-esque granite.

Start below the ugly chimney in the pegmatite and then move right to climb the splitter crack to the right. Climb through the pegmatite band and dontinue up splitter cracks, trending left before arriving at the base of the upper face and arete. Climb just left of the arete past two bolts with a height dependent crux at the last bolt (maybe 5.9 if you're tall but seemingly much harder if you're short).
content.protection: Gear to 3" and 2 bolts at the top on the face.
content.location: In the middle of the west face, look for the big, ugly chimney in the pegmatite. This climb starts below that chimney before climbing a splitter to the right.

content.description: Climb easy terrain to the overhanging arete (crux) and then a moderate finish to the anchor.
content.location: On the right side of the south face, just above the gate.

content.description: Start on the arete or on the left (west) side of the arete and climb the south face. The crux is some reachy moves before or through the roof at midheight. Significantly easier climbing is found above. Where the crux is will probably be rather height dependent on this route. Shares anchor with the Right Side West Face route.
content.location: On the left side of the south face (facing the interstate).

content.description:
This is a quality, slightly more difficult variation to the crack on the east face. Do the same start as the

Crack East Face

and from the ledge move left and climb the thin crack that zig zags up the face.
content.protection:
Gear to 2 inches. It shares the same anchor as

Crack East Face

route.
content.location:
This is just left of the

Crack East Face

from the ledge 20 feet off the ground.

content.description: Make a bouldery move behind a rose bush to gain access to a ledge twenty feet above the ground. Then, sink your mitts into sinker hand jams in the double crack system before mantling on to the upper ledge with the anchor.
content.location: This is on the east face is an obvious splitter crack above a ledge twenty feet up.
